definition: to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: It is a fore-runner of China's reform and opening-up.
sentences.chinese: 众所周知，深圳是中国改革开放的先驱和样板。

sentences.english: China was a society with high equality before the reform and opening-up.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以前我国是一个均等化程度较高的社会。

sentences.english: China's foreign trade agency system initiated at the beginning of the reform and opening.
sentences.chinese: 中国的外贸代理制始于改革开放之初。

sentences.english: Non - public - owned organizations in China have achieved great development since the reform and opening up.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以来，我国的非公有制经济有了快速的发展。

sentences.english: The most salient feature of the new period is reform and opening up.
sentences.chinese: 新时期最鲜明的特点是改革开放。

sentences.english: Before the economic reforms, Beijing's largest department store was the Wangfujing Hundred Goods Emporium.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以前，北京最大的商店就是王府井百货大楼。

sentences.english: Since China' s reform and opening policy, the non-state running enterprises of Wenzhou have made great progress.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以来，温州民营经济取得了长足的进展。

sentences.english: Shenzhen's success gave a further push to continue reforms and opening up.
sentences.chinese: 深证的成功进一步推动了改革开放的继续实行。

sentences.english: Troops is that China reforms open convoying person.
sentences.chinese: 军队是中国改革开放的护航者。

sentences.english: This year marks the 30th anniversary of reform and opening-up in China.
sentences.chinese: 今年是中国改革开放30周年。

sentences.english: The nuclear industry tactic transferred and the nuclear power grew up rapidly since the reform and opening of China.
sentences.chinese: 改革开放以来，核工业战略转移，核电产业迅速崛起。

sentences.english: The fundamental way out lies in reform and openness.
sentences.chinese: 根本出路在于改革开放。

sentences.english: With the deepening of reform and opening-up of our country, many people dream of going abroad for further study.
sentences.chinese: 随着我国改革开放的加深，很多人梦想着出国深造。

sentences.english: China has scored notable achievements over the past 30-odd years since reform and opening-up.
sentences.chinese: 中国改革开放30多年来，取得举世瞩目的发展成就。

sentences.english: Therefore, emancipation of the mind is the direct motive force of reform and opening-up.
sentences.chinese: 因此，解放思想是中国改革开放的直接动力。

sentences.english: Young cadre is national future, it is the brunt of our country reforming and opening.
sentences.chinese: 青年干部是国家的未来，是我国改革开放的主力。

definition: economic reform
market economy
economic development
rural household contract responsibility system, PRC government policy linking rural income to productivity
pinyin: nong2 cun1 jia1 ting2 lian2 chan3 cheng2 bao1 ze2 ren4 zhi4
related.word: 农村家庭联产承包责任制

definition: to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
to change track
planned economy
economic system
land reform
national industry/industry run by Chinese nationals or ethnic Chinese
commodity economy
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies
fixing of farm output quotas for each household
modernization of industry, one of Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations
collectivization of agriculture (in Marxist theory)
